abstract: First-quarter earnings fell 36 percent on sharply lower profits at G.E.’s troubled finance arm, but the results beat Wall Street forecasts in a glimmer of good news for the company.
snippet: First-quarter earnings fell 36 percent on sharply lower profits at G.E.’s troubled finance arm, but the results beat Wall Street forecasts in a glimmer of good news for the company.
lead_paragraph: The industrial conglomerate General Electric held up reasonably well in a difficult first quarter, with its industrial businesses showing slight gains in profit and its struggling finance unit staying in the black.

headline.main: G.E.’s First-Quarter Net Tops Analysts’ Estimates
headline.print_headline: G.E.’s First-Quarter Net Tops Analysts’ Estimates

abstract: The General Electric Company said Friday that its first-quarter earnings fell 36 percent on sharply lower profits at its troubled finance arm, but the results beat Wall Street forecasts in a glimmer of good news for the struggling company.
lead_paragraph: The General Electric Company said Friday that its first-quarter earnings fell 36 percent on sharply lower profits at its troubled finance arm, but the results beat Wall Street forecasts in a glimmer of good news for the struggling company.
